metadata.Title: CVE-2019-12418 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description: When Apache Tomcat 9.0.0.M1 to 9.0.28, 8.5.0 to 8.5.47, 7.0.0 and 7.0.97 is configured with the JMX Remote Lifecycle Listener, a local attacker without access to the Tomcat process or configuration files is able to manipulate the RMI registry to perform a man-in-the-middle attack to capture user names and passwords used to access the JMX interface. The attacker can then use these credentials to access the JMX interface and gain complete control over the Tomcat instance.

criterions.comment: tomcat7: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
tomcat8: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
tomcat9: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
